intro: Marsdenia vohiborensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves, and its flowers are typically pink or white with five petals. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
